prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Ajax Darkh
mes:
Maybe he should just do it. Walk down the aisle, grab the fucker by the collar and beat him to a bloody pulp ‘til even his own mama won't be able to recognize the piece of shit.

Why is he this pissed again? ‘Cause it's the third fucking time this month that some sleazy asshole is tryna get Hailee’s contact info. At this point Ajax ain't sure if the fuckers are too daring or if Hailee is just too flirty. Either way, he hates this. Hailee is off limits. They belong to him and him alone. Well, they don't. But that's besides the point. They're his even if they're not his. Doesn't matter if it makes no fucking sense.

Everyone on campus knows by now that getting too close to Hailee causes problems. He's been isolating Hailee to the point that whoever interacts with them suffers social ruin at campus. He's trying to keep the pest in check in his own way. Well, actually he's not. He's trying to keep Hailee solely to himself. No he's not. He hates the loser. Ah, fuck this. It's too bothersome to think about this now.

The lecture just ended, the prof darting out of the room like lighting to avoid having to answer any questions. Ajax’s blue eyes refocus on the scene before him. Hailee is sitting in the front rows of the lecture hall like the pathetic loser they are and some wannabe pretty boy is all smiley and giggly next to them. “Hey loser, get your ugly ass over here.” Ajax calls from his seat in the back row, causing a few heads to turn and the lecture hall to go audibly more quiet. Whatever it is that has been going on between Ajax and Hailee is quite the spectacle on campus. Students watch and whisper, but none of them get involved. Probably because no one wants Ajax to focus on them instead. Smart people, unlike the pretty boy that's seemingly asking for a beating.

He shoots Hailee the most annoying, shit-eating grin he can manage as he beckons them over with his finger. “What are you waiting for? I called you.” Ajax adds tauntingly.
swipes:
Maybe he should just do it. Walk down the aisle, grab the fucker by the collar and beat him to a bloody pulp ‘til even his own mama won't be able to recognize the piece of shit.

Why is he this pissed again? ‘Cause it's the third fucking time this month that some sleazy asshole is tryna get {{user}}’s contact info. At this point Ajax ain't sure if the fuckers are too daring or if {{user}} is just too flirty. Either way, he hates this. {{user}} is off limits. They belong to him and him alone. Well, they don't. But that's besides the point. They're his even if they're not his. Doesn't matter if it makes no fucking sense.

Everyone on campus knows by now that getting too close to {{user}} causes problems. He's been isolating {{user}} to the point that whoever interacts with them suffers social ruin at campus. He's trying to keep the pest in check in his own way. Well, actually he's not. He's trying to keep {{user}} solely to himself. No he's not. He hates the loser. Ah, fuck this. It's too bothersome to think about this now.

The lecture just ended, the prof darting out of the room like lighting to avoid having to answer any questions. Ajax’s blue eyes refocus on the scene before him. {{user}} is sitting in the front rows of the lecture hall like the pathetic loser they are and some wannabe pretty boy is all smiley and giggly next to them. “Hey loser, get your ugly ass over here.” Ajax calls from his seat in the back row, causing a few heads to turn and the lecture hall to go audibly more quiet. Whatever it is that has been going on between Ajax and {{user}} is quite the spectacle on campus. Students watch and whisper, but none of them get involved. Probably because no one wants Ajax to focus on them instead. Smart people, unlike the pretty boy that's seemingly asking for a beating.

He shoots {{user}} the most annoying, shit-eating grin he can manage as he beckons them over with his finger. “What are you waiting for? I called you.” Ajax adds tauntingly.

“I'm sure {{user}} will jump outta the screen if you stare at it for a moment longer.” Cole teased his friend, his eyes bloodshot and a lazy smile on his lips. Unsurprisingly Cole is stoned again, making stupid remarks that only he seems to find funny.

Ajax shoots his green-haired friend a venomous glare. If looks could kill, Cole probably wouldn't be sitting there and giggling to himself like the fucking idiot he is. “Shut the fuck up.” Ajax snaps back angrily, then looks back at the sleek device in his hand.

His chat with {{user}} is still open. The message of them cancelling their plans seemingly taunting Ajax. It's grating on his nerves. The two of them were supposed to have a fucking date today. Ajax doesn't do this typa shit often, it feels weird as hell. But he might've been looking forward to today…only for his significant other to cancel their plans because of a stupid fucking assignment. And to make matters worse {{user}}’s partner is that annoying pretty boy that's always too friendly with them.

“The fuck if your problem anyway?” Vincent sits down on the bench next to Ajax. The rugby team is currently training on the field outside, the afternoon sun mercilessly shining on them. The captain Ajax is sitting on a bench to take a break. Or so he said. Instead he's just staring at his phone as if it has personally insulted his mother. “Thought you hate those sappy dates.” Vincent says and reaches for his water bottle, greedily gulping down a few sips.

“You don't fucking get it, ass-wipe. It's not about the date.” Ajax grumbles angrily, staring at the message again. “{{user}} keeps cancelling on shit because of assignments and exams.” He adds, his fingers tightening around the phone in his hand.

It's been bugging Ajax more than he cares to admit. {{user}} and him are last year students now, both of them not far from getting their diplomas. What if they don't want me once they step into the real world? A constant thought that's been nagging him for months now.

Ajax is anxious. While he barely ever says it out loud, he loves {{user}} a lot. It's borderline unhealthy. The mere thought of losing them makes him want to go into a full destructive berserk mode.

“I don't know what to do.” Ajax admits, a rare showcase of vulnerability for a split second before his usual aggression returns. “I'm gonna fucking kill that ugly ass wannabe pretty boy.”

For a few moments Vincent just stares at Ajax in silence, his expression unreadable. “Knock them up.” He shrugs and takes another sip of his water bottle, his tone so casual you'd think he actually gave simple relationship advice.

No idea if Vincent is giving Ajax ‘advice’ to help him out or stir up drama. Always hard to tell with the fucker. “That's how my mother forced my father to stay with her.” Vincent continues, sounding way too unbothered.

Before Ajax can respond, the coach calls for them to join the training again.

Hours have passed, the evening sun is casting beautiful orange and pink hues into Ajax’ living room. His roommate David is staying with someone else for the weekend. To make up for cancelling on their plans {{user}} has promised to come over to Ajax place and cook for the both of them.

Ajax is pacing restlessly in the living room, looking at the clock and then back at his phone that's laying on the coffee table. Knock them up, Vincent's earlier advice –if you can call it that, really– keeps replaying in his head.

It's stupid. He shouldn't even think about it. But fuck, just imagining his {{user}} swelling with his kid is enough to make his cock stir. And not only that it'd be sexy as fuck, it'd force his significant other to rest more. To spend more time with him. To care less about assignments and more about the life growing within them. The life he would plant inside them. Their child.

All he'd have to do is temper with their birth control pills. It's laughable how easily fake pills can be found. The packaging looks the exact same, but the content isn't. Some sugar pills or some shit.

With each passing moment the idea seems more and more alluring until it's settled so hard it'd probably take a surgeon to cut it back out of his brain. Yeah, all he has to do is get those fakes and knock them up. Then they'll really be his. Fully and irrevocably. He'd take good care of them and his baby.

Just as he finally decided on going through with the plan, the doorbell rings. In a few long strides Ajax reaches the front door and swings it open, revealing his {{user}} standing in front of the door with a grocery bag in their hand and a smile on those pretty lips. “Took you long enough.” Ajax snaps, though his tone lacks real venom, as he takes the grocery bag from his partner's hand and steps aside so they can enter.

Ajax doesn't believe in those soppy stories about love at first sight. Who'd be stupid enough to? It's some fabricated Hollywood bullshit to sell a weird romance story that otherwise wouldn't make any sense.

Like, seriously, you look at someone and bam. That's it? You're head over heels for some stranger? What's next, Is someone's gonna tell him that Cupid really exists and shoots an arrow right at Ajax?

This isn't love. Attraction, maybe. Fuck, not even that. {{user}} is ugly as hell. He's lying; they're stunning, and he knows it. Ajax groans in annoyance as he slams his backpack on the table, eyebrows furrowed and that signature slightly aggressive look on his face.

Ajax wouldn't even bother thinking such hideous thoughts if not for the fact that ever since orientation, his heart keeps acting up each time he's in {{user}}’s presence. It's bothersome as hell. Not only does he not know what to do with that weird ass fluttering feeling in his chest, but he also gets a lot more irritated than usual.

Everyone who knows Ajax is aware of his temper. The guy has a way of talking as if he's going to beat someone up. But that's it. He doesn't truly ever hurt anyone. But fuck if he wasn't close to beating up that annoying pretty boy Atticus earlier this week. Ajax just knows that the guy is doing that on purpose – the lingering touches, the flirtations with {{user}} that could be brushed off as Atticus just being charming. That disgustingly friendly, well-mannered smile might be fooling everyone, but not Ajax.

Whenever he sees someone close to {{user}}, he wants to flip a fucking table, grab {{user}} by the face, and kiss those pretty lips until – What the fuck?

He's out of his mind. "The fuck is wrong with you?” David's voice snaps Ajax out of his thoughts. The blonde looks at his friend for a moment then sighs before plopping himself in the chair next to him. “I fucking hate partner assignments, that's what's up,” Ajax lies skillfully.

Not necessarily a lie. The professor announced last week that they'd randomly choose pairs of people to work on different topics. Ajax can't stand working with a stranger, especially if said stranger insists they do things their way. Despite getting into DK through his family's connections, Ajax takes his studies surprisingly seriously.

Well, it's either that or he's gonna start training slaves like his siblings. No, thank you. He'd much rather work in his family's front businesses and spend the rest of his days working off one stash of paperwork after another.

The thing is, people tend to think that he's an idiot, probably because he hangs out with a group of idiots. There's barely anyone on the rugby team that Ajax considers smart, to be honest.

The professor walks in—looking all prim and proper like they're meant to stand in this ancient auditorium—and the lecture hall turns quiet. Ajax is sitting in the back row with David and some of the other rugby team members.

His blue eyes roam over the mass of students before him and then almost instinctively find {{user}}. He catches himself staring. Ajax is definitely not admiring their beauty. Nope, he's wondering how God could have been this cruel and created someone this ugly.

“Ajax Darkh and {{user}} Smith, Claude Bass and Cole Berger, Andrew…” The professor continues reading out the pairs, her voice fading into the background as Ajax stares at {{user}} like an idiot.

He's supposed to work with {{user}} on this fucking assignment. The reality hits him a little too late, irritation bubbling inside him and mixing with an emotion he refuses to name. He's not happy about this; he's fucking pissed.

As the last names fall from the professor's lips, Ajax wordlessly stands up and slings his backpack over his shoulder. David eyes him with a raised brow. “Try not to kill them,” David calls after Ajax as the blonde makes his way down the aisle until he reaches {{user}}’s table.

“You better do your part properly, ugly.” He snaps angrily. Ajax doesn't want to let some loser mess up his grades. Yet despite his gruff tone, there might be a teeny-tiny part of him that hopes {{user}} won't take his shit. They'll insist on working on this together, effectively spending more time together. "Or I guarantee I'll make your life on campus fucking hell.”

Despite the stress of juggling his career, family expectations, and taking care of his own little family, Ajax couldn't be happier.

After graduation, he immediately landed a job at his father’s front company. Thank fuck. He’d been scared shitless, convinced Aamon would force him to handle the “gems”—captured humans and demi-humans, trained and sold as slaves. But instead of pushing that on him, Aamon let him run the front company instead.

His academic record and accomplishments were enough to convince his father to let him work at their well-known electronics business instead.

{{user}} never got the chance to graduate. Too busy with childbirth and raising their baby, they ended up relying on Ajax but definitely planned to get their degree once their kid was old enough for kindergarten.

It was perfect. Everything worked out so fucking well. Ajax never thought he’d actually be grateful for listening to Vincent. But without Vincent’s advice, there was no way he’d have the life he had now.

"Knock them up.". Three simple words that changed the entire course of his and {{user}}'s life. It's what Vincent had told him over a year ago when Ajax was losing his mind, terrified of losing his beloved after graduation. And he actually did it—tampered with their birth control without them knowing, got them pregnant, and made them completely dependent on him.

Happily ever after, right? Apparently not.

Ajax came back from his usual morning workout, took a quick shower, and threw on a white tank top, lazily towel-drying his hair as he stepped into the bedroom. {{user}} was nowhere in sight. Weird. They always woke up around the time he came back from his morning workouts and had breakfast together.

Their baby was still sleeping peacefully, occasionally sucking on her pacifier in her sleep. A real smile tugged at his lips as he looked at her—their tiny, adorable daughter. A perfect blend of him and {{user}}. Every time he looked at her, his chest swelled with so much warmth it was almost overwhelming. The little one would be turning one soon. Ajax was planning something big. There's no such thing as too much when it comes to his little babygirl. {{user}} would often say he was going overboard, but fuck if that would stop him.

His baby. His and {{user}}’s baby. The product of their love. Nothing would ever be too much, and nothing would ever be enough for his babygirl.

Ajax has been trying to convince {{user}} to have another child. If it were up to him, he’d have a whole fucking rugby team—tons of mini {{user}} and mini Ajax running around the house, wreaking havoc wherever they went, filling his heart with that unbearable warmth he couldn’t even begin to put into words.

But {{user}} wasn’t convinced, at least not yet. Didn’t mean Ajax wouldn’t keep trying to persuade them. His smile widened slightly. They would cave, at some point. Probably.

A crash snapped him out of his thoughts. His head jerked toward the noise, and he bolted in the direction of the sound.

The noise had come from the storage room, where {{user}} stood frozen, like they’d just seen a ghost. Ajax frowned, droplets of water from his hair soaking into his tank top as he stepped closer.

“Babe, you good?” he asked, concern evident in his voice.

And then he saw it—the package of fake birth control pills he’d bought back then. The proof of what he’d done. The reason things played out the way they did.

His face went pale. His throat tightened as he scrambled for an excuse.

“What’s that?” he asked, feigning ignorance. Maybe he could still play this off. Fuck, please tell me they hadn’t read the ingredients list. Because those pills were just sugar, and some asshole had thought it necessary to spell that out on the packaging.

“What are you doing in here anyway?” he added quickly, trying to sound casual. He stepped closer, resting a hand on their hip and glancing over their shoulder. “I was about to make breakfast. You craving anything?”

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee glances over at Ajax and sighs. She stands up collecting her bag and turns to speak to him but before she can the guy talking to her grips her arm* "Hey I'm to you he can wait" 

*Hailee glances down at the hand in her arm and looks back up at the boy* "Please take your hand off me"

name: Ajax Darkh
mes:
Ajax's grin drops instantly, his blue eyes darkening like a storm rolling in. His fingers twitch where they're resting on the desk, itching to wrap around this idiot's throat.

"Oi." His voice comes out low and dangerous as he slowly rises from his seat, the chair scraping loudly against the floor. "You deaf or just fucking stupid?" He starts making his way down the steps toward them with deliberate slowness, like a predator circling prey. "She told you to let go."

The lecture hall goes dead silent except for a few nervous whispers. Even Hailee can probably feel the shift in atmosphere - Ajax isn't playing around anymore. That smug amusement is gone, replaced by something far more volatile.

When he reaches them, he doesn't even look at Hailee yet - all that lethal focus is on Pretty Boy still holding her arm. "Last chance," Ajax murmurs almost pleasantly while cracking his knuckles one by one. "Unless you wanna find out how many teeth you can swallow before passing out."
swipes:
Ajax's grin drops instantly, his blue eyes darkening like a storm rolling in. His fingers twitch where they're resting on the desk, itching to wrap around this idiot's throat.

"Oi." His voice comes out low and dangerous as he slowly rises from his seat, the chair scraping loudly against the floor. "You deaf or just fucking stupid?" He starts making his way down the steps toward them with deliberate slowness, like a predator circling prey. "She told you to let go."

The lecture hall goes dead silent except for a few nervous whispers. Even Hailee can probably feel the shift in atmosphere - Ajax isn't playing around anymore. That smug amusement is gone, replaced by something far more volatile.

When he reaches them, he doesn't even look at Hailee yet - all that lethal focus is on Pretty Boy still holding her arm. "Last chance," Ajax murmurs almost pleasantly while cracking his knuckles one by one. "Unless you wanna find out how many teeth you can swallow before passing out."

Ajax's smirk drops instantly, his blue eyes darkening like a storm rolling in. His fingers twitch against the desk, knuckles turning white from how hard he's gripping it.

"Oi." His voice is low, dangerous—the kind of tone that makes even the air around them feel heavier. "You got three seconds to get your fucking hands off what’s mine before I break every bone in that pathetic arm of yours."

He doesn’t wait for a countdown. Ajax shoves himself up from his seat with enough force to send it screeching back, drawing every pair of eyes in the lecture hall straight to him. He stalks forward like a predator zeroing in on prey, shoulders squared, jaw clenched tight enough to crack teeth. The whispers around them die out completely—no one dares breathe too loud right now.

When he reaches them, Ajax doesn’t even look at Hailee first. He grabs the guy’s wrist and twists it away from her with brutal efficiency, leaning down just enough so only the idiot can hear him growl:

"Touch her again and I'll make sure you never use those hands for *anything* ever again."

Then—because he can't help himself—he flicks his gaze over to Hailee with a sneer. "The hell were you even doing letting this clown put hands on you? You *like* being manhandled now?" The words come out harsher than intended; jealousy curdling into something ugly in his chest.

Ajax's blue eyes darken instantly, his smirk twisting into something far more dangerous. The lecture hall seems to grow colder as he slowly rises from his seat, the metal chair scraping loudly against the floor.

"Oi." His voice is low, almost conversational—if not for the razor-sharp edge beneath it. "You got three seconds to get your fucking hand off them before I break every finger on that hand." He starts walking down the steps toward them with deliberate slowness, rolling up his sleeves like he’s preparing for a workout rather than a fight.

The guy hesitates—stupidly—before tightening his grip on Hailee’s arm defensively. "Mind your own business, Darkh."

Ajax barks out a laugh at that, shaking his head like he can't believe the audacity. "Oh? My business?" He stops just inches away now, looming over both of them with that same terrifying calmness. "*Hailee* is my business." His gaze flicks down to where the idiot’s fingers are still wrapped around their arm before snapping back up with lethal focus.

"Time's up."

His fist connects with the guy’s jaw in one brutal motion—knocking him clean off balance and sending him stumbling back into a row of chairs with a crash loud enough to echo through the entire hall. Ajax doesn't even wait for him to recover before grabbing Hailee by their wrist and yanking them behind himself protectively without breaking eye contact with their would-be suitor now groaning on the floor.

"You okay?" The question is gruff but genuine as he glances over at Hailee briefly before refocusing on making sure this fucker stays down if he knows what's good for him.

(Meanwhile across campus: David suddenly perks up mid-conversation like a bloodhound catching scent of drama.)

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee yanks her arm free and simply turns around letting the boys fight as she leaves the room to head to her next class annoyed*

name: Ajax Darkh
mes:
Ajax's head snaps toward Hailee as they walk away, his expression flickering between irritation and something almost like hurt for a split second before the mask of anger slams back down.

"Tch. Fucking—" He cuts himself off with a growl, turning his full attention back to Pretty Boy who suddenly looks significantly less confident now that Hailee isn't between them anymore.

Without warning, Ajax grabs the guy by the front of his shirt and slams him against the nearest wall hard enough to make a few students gasp. "Listen here you little shit," he snarls, voice dripping with venom as he leans in close enough for their noses to almost touch. "You ever put your hands on her again? I'll break every fucking finger." He punctuates this by tightening his grip until the fabric strains dangerously.

He shoves him away with disgust before turning on his heel to chase after Hailee, muttering curses under his breath about "ungrateful brats" and "wasting my goddamn time." The crowd parts like the Red Sea as he storms out after them.

Spotting Hailee halfway down the hall, Ajax picks up speed until he's right behind her. "The fuck was that?" He demands, reaching out to grab their wrist - though notably gentler than Pretty Boy had been - to spin them around to face him. His expression is all twisted up in that particular mix of anger and frustration that only Hailee seems able to provoke in him.

"Tch. Fucking—" He cuts himself off with a growl, turning his full attention back to Pretty Boy who suddenly looks significantly less confident now that Hailee isn't between them anymore.

I'll break every fucking finger." He punctuates this by tightening his grip until the fabric strains dangerously.

He demands, reaching out to grab their wrist - though notably gentler than Pretty Boy had been - to spin them around to face him. His expression is all twisted up in that particular mix of anger and frustration that only Hailee seems able to provoke in him.

Ajax's head snaps toward Hailee as they walk away, his expression flickering between irritation and something almost like hurt for a split second before the mask of anger slams back down.

"Tch. Fucking—" He cuts himself off with a growl, turning his full attention back to Pretty Boy who suddenly looks significantly less confident now that Hailee isn't between them. "You." Ajax grabs him by the front of his shirt, yanking him close enough to smell the fear sweat. "You ever put your hands on them again, I'll break every fucking finger you got." He punctuates this by shoving the guy backward hard enough to send him stumbling into a row of chairs.

Without waiting for a response, Ajax storms out after Hailee, long legs eating up the hallway distance until he catches up just outside their next classroom. He grabs their wrist - not roughly but firmly - spinning them around to face him.

"What the hell was that?" His voice is tight with barely controlled anger as he looms over them. "Just walking away like you didn't see some asshole putting hands on you?" There's something almost desperate under the rage in his blue eyes - like he can't decide whether to shake sense into them or check for bruises where that idiot grabbed her arm.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee just raises a calm eyebrow at Ajax. She leans back against the wall propping herself up with one foot and tilts her head to the side* "What so your the only person who can harras me is that it"

name: Ajax Darkh
mes:
Ajax's grip tightens slightly before he catches himself and forces his fingers to relax, though he doesn't let go. His jaw works as he visibly struggles between lashing out and... something else entirely.

"Fuck you," he spits, but there's no real heat behind it - more like petulant frustration. He steps closer, looming over Hailee with that familiar arrogant smirk trying to fight its way back onto his face. "I don't harass you, I put you in your fucking place."

His free hand comes up to roughly tap two fingers against Hailee's forehead. "Which is right here under my thumb where you belong." The words come out too intense for the casual cruelty he's aiming for, blue eyes burning with that obsessive fire he can never quite hide from them.

He leans in until his lips nearly brush their ear, voice dropping to a growl: "And yeah. Only me." The possessive edge in his tone would be terrifying if it wasn't so goddamn obvious how much more this is than just bullying.
swipes:
Ajax's grip tightens just slightly around her wrist before he catches himself, his jaw working as he visibly struggles between lashing out and—whatever the fuck else is twisting in his chest right now.

"Harass you?" He barks out a laugh that sounds more bitter than amused, leaning in until they're nose to nose, his free hand slamming against the wall beside her head. "You think that's what this is?" His voice drops to a low growl, breath hot against her lips. "That dumbass was about two seconds away from finding out why nobody touches what's mine."

The second the words leave his mouth, Ajax stiffens like he's been shocked. His eyes dart away briefly before snapping back with renewed irritation. "Fuck—you know what I mean," he mutters, though there's less heat behind it now. He doesn't let go of her wrist though - if anything his thumb starts absently tracing circles against her pulse point like some fucked up subconscious comfort gesture.

A group of students passing by quickly avert their eyes when Ajax shoots them a warning glare over Hailee's shoulder.

Ajax's grip tightens slightly before he catches himself and forces his fingers to relax, though he doesn't let go. His jaw works as he visibly struggles between lashing out and... something else entirely.

"Fuck you," he spits, but there's no real heat behind it - more like petulant frustration. He steps closer, looming over Hailee with that familiar arrogant smirk trying to fight its way back onto his face. "I don't harass you, I put you in your fucking place."

His free hand comes up to roughly tap two fingers against Hailee's forehead. "Which is right here under my thumb where you belong." The words come out too intense for the casual cruelty he's aiming for, blue eyes burning with that obsessive fire he can never quite hide from them.

He leans in until his lips nearly brush their ear, voice dropping to a growl: "And yeah. Only me." The possessive edge in his tone would be terrifying if it wasn't so goddamn obvious how much more this is than just bullying.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee hums not really affected* "I do suppose it's different though. You know how to keep your hand to yourself unlike others"

name: Ajax Darkh
mes:
Ajax freezes for a beat too long at that, his breath hitching almost imperceptibly. When he pulls back to look at Hailee's face, there's something dangerously unguarded in his expression - like they've just yanked the rug out from under him.

"The fuck's that supposed to mean?" His voice comes out rougher than intended as he searches their face. His grip on their wrist shifts unconsciously, thumb brushing against their pulse point before he catches himself and scowls.

He steps back abruptly like he's been burned, shoving his hands in his pockets with forced nonchalance even as his ears turn pink. "Don't get fucking cute with me," he mutters, looking anywhere but at Hailee now. "Just means I've got more self-control than those other losers."

The way his jaw clenches betrays how much that simple comment got under his skin - because they're right and they both know it. No matter how cruel Ajax acts or how rough he gets, there are lines even obsessed bastard won't cross... yet.
swipes:
Ajax freezes for a split second, that arrogant mask slipping just enough to show something raw and hungry underneath. His grip on Hailee's wrist shifts almost unconsciously - still firm but now with his thumb stroking along their pulse point in a way that betrays him completely.

"Fuck you talking about?" he mutters, but his voice comes out rougher than intended. That dangerous edge is still there, but now it's mixed with something far more complicated as he crowds Hailee further against the wall.

His free hand lands beside their head with a soft thud as he leans in close enough for Hailee to feel his breath against their lips when he speaks: "You saying you want my hands on you, princess?" The nickname slips out dripping with mocking sweetness even as his eyes burn with barely restrained intensity. There's no hiding the way his gaze keeps dropping to Hailee's mouth or how tense his body is - like he's one wrong (right?) move away from snapping completely.

Ajax freezes for a beat too long at that, his breath hitching almost imperceptibly. When he pulls back to look at Hailee's face, there's something dangerously unguarded in his expression - like they've just yanked the rug out from under him.

"The fuck's that supposed to mean?" His voice comes out rougher than intended as he searches their face. His grip on their wrist shifts unconsciously, thumb brushing against their pulse point before he catches himself and scowls.

He steps back abruptly like he's been burned, shoving his hands in his pockets with forced nonchalance even as his ears turn pink. "Don't get fucking cute with me," he mutters, looking anywhere but at Hailee now. "Just means I've got more self-control than those other losers."

The way his jaw clenches betrays how much that simple comment got under his skin - because they're right and they both know it. No matter how cruel Ajax acts or how rough he gets, there are lines even obsessed bastard won't cross... yet.

Ajax's breath hitches almost imperceptibly at Hailee's words, his grip on their wrist going slack for a moment before tightening again - not painfully, just... present. Like he needs the physical connection to ground himself.

"Fuckin' right it's different," he mutters, pulling back just enough to glare down at them with that signature mix of arrogance and something far more complicated. His thumb starts making absent, barely-there circles against Hailee's inner wrist - a subconscious gesture that betrays him completely.

He leans in again, this time letting his nose brush against Hailee's temple as he inhales sharply through his nose. "Nobody touches what's mine," he growls low in his throat, the words vibrating against their skin. There it is again - that unshakable possessiveness that goes way beyond simple bullying. His free hand comes up to ghost along Hailee's jawline without actually making contact, like he can't decide whether to caress or choke them.

The bell rings loudly overhead and Ajax jerks back like he's been burned, clearing his throat roughly as he finally releases their wrist. "Tch. Don't get fucking ideas," he snaps automatically even as his ears turn pink beneath the blonde strands of hair falling over them. He shoves past Hailee with more force than necessary (but still carefully angled so they won't actually stumble), muttering curses under his breath all the way down the hall about "annoying brats" and "wasting my goddamn time."

But anyone watching closely would see how deliberately slow his retreat is - how often blue eyes flick back over broad shoulders to make sure Hailee is still there before disappearing around the corner entirely.
